Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014002185.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Géraldine Dufresne was seen for the last time at her residence in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec. Géraldine did not report to work, nor did she inform her employer of her absence. All of her belongings were left in her apartment.

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2014004588.CaseDesc: On November 23, 1986, Pierre-Jean Durocher was last seen. He was reported missing on November 25, 1986, by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. Durocher lived in a rooming house in Longueuil. His backpack containing his identification was found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge in Montreal.

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2006005999.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1994, the body of a male was found in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 120 lbs and his length was measured approximately 5’8"-5’9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days to several weeks.

Teeth: Natural teeth with amalgam fillings on numerous teeth
Scar: Left Forearm, Z-plasty scar, 6x5x7cm, may have been the result of plastic surgery following a fracture
Right Ring Finger, Small linear scar on the knuckle, 2cm

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2013000027.CaseDesc: Nancy Joanne Forbes has not been seen or heard from since November 7, 2006. She was last seen at a bus stop on her way to a job interview in the Burnside Industrial Park in Dartmouth NS.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White
Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2014006341.CaseDesc: Alma Mae Gillespie has been missing since June 10th, 1996 from her residence in Winnipeg, MB. Prior to her disappearance, she talked of wanting to go away and disappear for a while.  This has been done on numerous occasions before, even for years at a time.  In the past she has resurfaced within either the United States or Canada.

Case reference: 2019078296.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1981, Erzsébet Tánczos Szita was seen for the last time at her home on Nun’s Island in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Erzsébet prepared her husband’s lunch before he left for work. Later that morning, their housekeeper arrived at their residence for her last day of work, and subsequently contacted Mr. Szita to inform him of his wife’s disappearance. Erzsébet is of Hungarian origin.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001017.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was found at the junction of Highways 40 & 540 in Vaudreuil, Quebec. A guitar and harmonica were found with the man and he had five gold fillings.

Boots: Suede, Yellow, With clip as laces
Coat: Blue, White, Chasseur, Plaid blue and white
Nylon, Dark Blue, Anoraque, Orange lining with hood

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2020012524.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1993, at approximately 2:45pm, Lois Dunlavy was seen for the last time as she attended the Scarborough General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Lois had been examined by a physician and when the physician returned to check on her, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014005026.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2007, Eric Cox was seen for the last time when he boarded the Marine Atlantic Ferry in North Sydney, Nova Scotia heading to Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2006005599.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1980, Foster Bezanson departed the Abitibi Road 48 area near Cochrane, Ontario to go hunting.  Mr. Bezanson failed to return and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2020001463.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2018, Sharon Gronfeldt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New-Brunswick to meet someone in the City of Moncton, New-Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009003999.CaseDesc: At about 1 p.m. Robert Aho of North Bay left Land O’Lakes Cottages located in Martin River and headed west bound on Highway 64 towards Field. He was carrying a packsack and duffle bag and has not been in contact with his family since.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeved, Toronto Maple Leaf

Case reference: 2014001128.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1991, the body of an unknown female was found floating in the Fraser River in New Westminster, BC.  She was observed on the water directly under the Patullo Bridge between the wharf and a fishing vessel called the "Sea Cap X". The female had been in the water for a prolonged period of time and may be of Aboriginal or Asian descent.

Belt: Leather, Blue, With a belt buckle
Jewelry: Gold, Hoop earrings in both ears
Gold, Cardinal brand wristwatch, right wrist
Scar: Right Wrist, 3 cm horizontal and 1 cm oblique

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014001572.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1970, Arthur Stephens left his home in Gimli, Manitoba. He had planned to go fishing in the Whiteshell Provincial Park. Arthur told his wife that he would return on July 21, 1970. He further advised her that if he was going to stay any longer, he would call her to let her know. By July 22, 1970, Arthur had not returned home and his wife hadn't received a phone call. She reported him missing to police that day. On August 1, 1970, Arthur's vehicle was located near Falcon Beach.  Extensive ground, lake and air searches were done of the area. All efforts to locate him failed to uncover any further leads. Arthur Stephens whereabouts remain unknown.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Circular tattoo (exact design/pattern unknown)

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2013000085.CaseDesc: On April 17, 1994, Jose Fernandez was seen for the last time at his residence in the Villeray district in Montreal, Quebec. Following a disagreement, Jose left home in his car without saying where he was going. The vehicle was a red, 4-door Mercury Capri.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2016065648.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1968, skeletal remains were located at the base of a 50 foot cliff on the bank of the lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls. A pair of boots was located with the remains.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2014006004.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2013, Timmothy Benedict-Leaf was last seen at his family residence in Akwesasne, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006017299.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1998, Jake Just attended a party at a residence in the north end of the town of Midland. He was last seen walking home from the party, then separating from his friends to take a short cut through a wooded area. An extensive search of the area turned up negative.

Shoes: Canvas, Black, Blue, "DVS" - skateboarder style - size 11
Backpack: Nylon, Black, Gold, jaguar logo and gold stitching
Scar: Left Upper Arm, 4" raised scar inside bicep

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie was last seen at home.

Jacket: Green Orange and Yellow Plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2006018999.CaseDesc: Sean MacIntyre was 13 years old at the time of a boating accident on July 25, 1980. The boat he was in started to take on water just after leaving Cockburn Island. The boat sank quickly in Lake Huron, North Channel, 2 kilometres Southwest of Bigsby Island. Occupants of the boat put on life jackets. Sean slipped out of his life jacket and is presumed  drowned. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2018027693.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, at around 8:30 am, Diane Mae Bignell was last seen on Juniper Street in Thompson, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2008009698.CaseDesc: Richard Rusholme was last seen when he left his residence.  He was preparing to leave with a friend to look for work out West and had already packed his bags. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020007968.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Aurelio Ferreira was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Aurelio was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005083.CaseDesc: Alexander Belcourt was reported missing by his family in November 1995. He has not been seen or heard from since September 1991. During the time of his disappearance, Alexander was known to live in the inner core of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was residing at the Gold Range Hotel in Yellowknife, NWT. When she went missing, her personal belongings were found left behind, including her glasses which she relied upon. Mary Rose may have been pregnant at the time of her disappearance.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2010003499.CaseDesc:
On March 21, 2010 Chung Law left work on Dundas St, London ON. He told his employer that he was experiencing some stress and would be taking a couple of days off. Mr. Law spoke to his wife, who lives in Vaughan, ON, and told her he was coming home for a visit. He spoke to his employer the next day, saying he was in Toronto and that he did not want to return to work in London. Mr. Law never did arrive home. Investigation has revealed that Mr. Law may have travelled to Toronto by bus. 

In April, 2011 a right foot contained within a black boot was located in the river flats of the Thames River in Elgin County. The area was searched and no further remains were found. DNA confirmed that the foot was that of Mr. Law.

Scar: Left Thigh, Surgery scar on upper left thigh

Case reference: 2013000037.CaseDesc: On November 29, 2001, Henry Murillo Asprilla was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. On that day, he had a meeting with lawyers, which he attended with his ex-wife. After the meeting he drove his ex-wife home. Henry has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004752.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2005 a man attended the Victoria Police Department and reported not seeing Belinda Cameron for over one month.  He told police Belinda had mentioned wanting to visit relatives in Vancouver and Manitoba but did not provide names to police.  This man reported sharing an intimate relationship with Belinda outside of his own marriage.  He said she was not a habitual runaway.  This man denied harming Belinda and through a Polygraph examination was determined to be honest.  The Victoria Police investigated Belinda's disappearance and determined that Belinda suffered from a mental illness, had a drug addiction and may have been a sex trade worker.  The last confirmed sighting of Belinda was at Shoppers Drug Mart at 870 Esquimalt Rd.  She failed to attend thereafter to pick up her daily medication.

Hair: Black, Long, Separated in the middle

Case reference: 2013000134.CaseDesc: Loretta (Lora) Ann Frank was last seen in Yukon Territory between late 1988 and early 1989. She was known to reside in Watson Lake and Whitehorse, Yukon as well as Lower Post, British Columbia. Loretta was reported missing in 1993. Loretta is known to have a history of mental health concerns.

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2012020081.CaseDesc: Emily Osmond (Laplante) lived a reclusive lifestyle on a small acreage on the Northern edge of Kawacatoose First Nation. Emily seldom had contact with her family or friends and the last known contact with them was August 29, 2007. She was last seen on the 9th of September, 2007, by her hired helper. Her disappearance is very unusual. Her vehicle and personal belongings including medication were left at her residence. She also had dogs at her acreage that she cared for that were left unattended. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Emily.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014004551.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1984, Robert Plewes was last seen at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. His truck was found six days later near Algonquin Park located in Ontario.

Case reference: 2016043636.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1976, the body of a woman was discovered in a backyard in the Parkdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2020008393.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1982, David Black was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. David is a chronic cancer patient.

Case reference: 2006019599.CaseDesc: Frank Szpak left his residence on September 23, 1996. He indicated he was going to pick blueberries and never returned. Mr. Szpak suffered from Alzheimer's Disease.

Hat: Blue, Baseball cap with "Motorola" on the front

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2014004773.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2000, Bassel El Youssef was seen for the last time when he left his mother’s residence in the Saint-Léonard District of Montreal, Quebec. Bassel has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2010003799.CaseDesc: On Wednesday August 16, 1972, at 9:40 pm, 14 year-old Ingrid Bauer left her residence in Kleinburg, now the city of Vaughan, enroute to meet her boyfriend at his North Woodbridge home. She was last seen hitchhiking southbound along the west side of Islington Avenue.  She never arrived at her boyfriend’s residence that night.  An extensive search based on information received from the public failed to locate Ingrid Bauer.

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014005112.CaseDesc: Tian You Li left his extended family home in East Vancouver to go for his routine walk. He never returned. He suffers from Alzheimers and may be confused and disorientated.

Case reference: 2014003777.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1988, François Piquet was seen for the last time when he left the family residence located in the Saint-Laurent district of Montreal, Quebec. François left his ID cards behind and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm , Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2014021185.CaseDesc: Around 13:00 hours on July 6, 2005, Kim-Marie Kinsella was last seen in the area of 1695 Jane Street Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.
